txt.en: 'I... do not know what to do, [placeholder]. For all of our preparations and the strength of our arms, Mazog and his ally Gorothúl have struck our hearts directly.\n\n'Perhaps Bósi will know what to do, but I fear he will be as lost as I am. Bróin came back to us from out of the darkness, but I am not as confident that Bori will do the same.'

Bósi stares at you for a moment and then closes his eyes.

'Are we finished, [placeholder]? All of the dwarves of this expedition rejoiced when Zigilburk was borne from the depths, but moreso at the safe return of my nephew Bróin. All things seemed possible! But now...'

He sighs heavily.

'My son is gone. How can I hope to lead my people to victory now? I cannot. I have not the will.'
'You must ask my cousin what to do, for I am completely out of ideas. I do not know how we can stand against Mazog and Gorothúl without the power of Zigilburk.'
Brogur is uncertain of what to do following the loss of Bori and Zigilburk, and fears the time of the dwarves in Moria may be nearly at an end.

Bósi is in the Chamber of the Cross-roads, at the southern end of Durin's Way, north of the Great Delving.\n\nBrogur has asked you to consult Bósi for some idea of what to do next, now that the dwarves have lost much of their hope of victory in Moria.
